intro: Scandix verna var. verna, commonly known as early scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. It blooms in early spring, producing white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators. The plant has a long history of use in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
